we need to let go.content: we need to let go
we can move forward
Saying more about that now just adds to the noise, so let’s move on. My mind swirled a bit when I first read this at Anne’s place and I’m still thinkin’ about it:
I will let you down

The long road flies by us as rain hits the hood of the old Ford.  What could we do but go along with this plan?  One day we'll grow up and do our own running.  One day we'll grow up and regress just like she has.
- so here we go
our importance is equal

we buy we try we fly to new places which look just like where we came from and offer no new answers click fast don’t stay don’t read don’t play just keep moving on to the next pointless wealth of information that we don’t really care about anyway we’re so cool for fools we’re so empty that we’re always longing to be full
"I'm gonna miss him.  He took care of us and now we're on our own.  But don't worry, I'll find another man who will love us."
those things we wish for

The reality is we’re all caught in the middle a non-stop shitshow. It won’t end well for it’s host but until it does end, I’ve got much better things to do with my time than to whine about it - fuck it!

We finally stop and for a moment, I think of running away.  They won't miss me - I'm not worth anything to them anyway.  It's a circular thing.  I go to the bathroom and return to the car knowing that I have nowhere else to go.  An eleven year old goes where he's taken.

“Why do you go away? So that you can come back. So that you can see the place you came from with new eyes and extra colors. And the people there see you differently, too. Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving.” - Terry Pratchett
it’s time to rock
So. Need to carry on and make the best of my time.
- the need to create

helplessly hoping to free myself of this load helplessly grabbing for the next winning number in the stream of addiction the next spinning thunder in the noise of the same old thing over and over and over again
so what if we never realize
holding on tight
Everyone I know goes away

it's baggage claim for the soul.content: it's baggage claim for the soul

so i speak and my soul leaks onto the tired pavement where we all met that night to share our inner thoughts with all the strangers we’ve never seen except in dreams of schemes of using them for our own selfish gain replacing the pain of true emptiness

we buy we try we fly to new places which look just like where we came from and offer no new answers click fast don’t stay don’t read don’t play just keep moving on to the next pointless wealth of information that we don’t really care about anyway we’re so cool for fools we’re so empty that we’re always longing to be full
getting lost is the real deal
getting lost on the web is all i live for now getting lost on the web is my fate getting lost on the web is a sign it’s too late

that blues song in my head ever changing ocean breeze and clarity objects of my hunger as somewhere on river street a mime mesmerizes strangers looking for the void they misplaced looks on their faces telling life stories
So. Need to carry on and make the best of my time.
Some stops in the journey border on unbearable but a new world is always just around the corner and when we’re lucky, it’s a better place.

“**Share what you enjoy or what you're curious about.** Not everyone will enjoy of it, some people will appreciate different things, but build friendships on mutual interests. **Don't be afraid to say you don't know something. Being forthright and asking for help is an admirable quality.**”
Be inquisitive. Know what you don't know.
